user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_init:
```c
int metal_init(const struct metal_init_params *params)
{
	int error = 0;

	if (_metal.common.ref_count++ != 0)
		return 0;

	memset(&_metal, 0, sizeof(_metal));

	_metal.common.log_handler   = params->log_handler;
	_metal.common.log_level     = params->log_level;

	metal_list_init(&_metal.common.bus_list);
	metal_list_init(&_metal.common.generic_shmem_list);
	metal_list_init(&_metal.common.generic_device_list);

	error = metal_sys_init(params);
	if (error)
		return error;

	++_metal.common.ref_count;
	return error;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (_metal.common.ref_count++ != 0)
		return 0;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the conditional uses a post-increment on _metal.common.ref_count and returns only when the previous value was non‑zero. If ref_count == 0 the function continues (so the code after the if is reachable); if ref_count != 0 the function returns early. There is no statically unreachable code produced by this fragment.
